chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L Niday was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Remitted. $67 VW surcharge due in 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted. $200 GPS surcharge remitted.
Remitted. Civil filing fee purs to sec 814.61(1)(d) & (e) & service fee purs to sec 814.70(1) from case 15CV551

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Stephanie R Hilton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
